sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: German police carry out massive raids against the far-right group Reich Citizens, leading to 25 arrests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia extends defence positions along its border with Ukraine, with reports of new elaborate trench digging designed to rebuff assault.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky has been named Time magazine's Person of the Year for inspiring people and nations to unite in defense of freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As bird flu cases surge across Europe, governments take further action to contain a potentially devastating epidemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thousands of police officers have carried out raids across much of Germany against suspected far-right extremists allegedly seeking to overthrow the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 25 people have been detained after officers searched 130 sites in 11 of Germany's 16 states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While police raids against the far- right are not uncommon in the country, the huge scale of the operation was rare.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Prosecutors say the group had planned an armed attack on institutions of the state, a violent overthrow to install a so-called prince as national leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Officials say they were inspired by the deep state conspiracy theories of the Reichsberger movement and QAnon. Members of the Reichsberger do not recognize Germany as a legitimate state. Some of them are devoted to the idea of a monarchy. Others believe the country is still under military occupation. Russia has recently started extending defensive positions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: along its international border with Ukraine and deep inside its Belgrade regions, says the UK Defence Ministry in the latest intelligence update, adding that trench digging has been reported in Belgrade since at least April 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But the new constructions are probably more elaborate systems designed to rebuff mechanised assault.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now, the Institute for the Study of War says Belgrade and Kursk regions have announced the formation of territorial defense units exposing many civilians to the war under what the think-tank calls the absurd premise of the threat of a Ukrainian ground assault on Russia's border regions. The UK Defense Ministry assesses that paucity in strategic assessment is one of the critical weaknesses in the central Russian government architecture, as highlighted by Russia's original decision to invade Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Impartial official analysis is almost certainly frequently undermined by tendency toward groupthink and politically expedient conclusions. There is a realistic possibility that the Russian authorities are promoting defensive preparations within internationally recognized Russian territory to burnish patriotic feelings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Institute for the Study of War adds the Kremlin seems to be departing from the limited war messaging it has been using to reduce concerns among the general Russian public about the war, likely in an effort to condition the public for future mobilization waves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian Ministry of Defense can only simultaneously train around 130,000 conscripts during a biennial conscription cycle in peacetime and has struggled painfully to prepare a larger number of mobilized men over a shorter period.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin is also increasing measures to prevent mobilized men and their families from complaining about mobilization problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Putin, for example, signed a law banning rallies in government buildings, universities, schools, etc., likely to suppress riots and protests among mobilized men and their families.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky has been named Time magazine's Person of the Year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In an article dedicated to the wartime leader, the New York-based publication credited the 44-year-old for, quote, proving that courage can be as contagious as fear and for inspiring people and nations to unite in defense of freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Times editor Edward Fentzenthal said Zelensky has galvanized the world in a way we haven't seen in decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: When Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine began on February 24th, the president was commended by world leaders for not fleeing Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Instead, he utilized his media skills to rally support in daily speeches to state parliaments, the World Bank and even the Grammy Awards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Zelensky has visited defending troops on the battlefield, sites of strikes and devastation across the country and hosted many Western diplomats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As the war nears the 10-month mark, Zelensky has vowed to push Russian forces out of Ukrainian territory once and for all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Bird flu cases are surging across Europe, prompting governments to take further action to contain a potentially devastating epidemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Millions of farm birds have already been culled in several countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: France's Vendee region is among the worst affected areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This farmer's business is still recovering from an outbreak last spring.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We also look at the farm from another angle, saying to ourselves, don't I also consider another production to secure the farm?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's what we're doing now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are considering new projects." In recent months, outbreaks have escalated dramatically, with France and Germany particularly affected. The virus has persisted over the summer and is expected to hit new peaks during winter. With culls and other restrictions limiting production, there are concerns about supply of poultry products this holiday season, including foie gras and Christmas turkeys.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The virus is normally spread from wild birds to farm livestock, where it can spread rapidly in closely confined pens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It can even endanger zoo animals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Last month, Berlin Zoo had to close its doors after one of its aquatic birds died and later tested positive to the virus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Similar cases were reported in other German zoos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a shock reversal, China is rolling back some of its most draconian coronavirus restrictions, part of its no-tolerance, zero-Covid policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The scale of lockdowns triggered by positive cases will be limited to individual floors in apartment blocks, rather than entire buildings or even neighbourhoods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: People who test positive for the virus will be able to isolate at home rather than in overcrowded and unsanitary field hospitals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Schools where there have been no outbreaks must return to in-class teaching.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Beijing has sought to retain its hardline policy, framing high levels of deaths in Western countries compared with China as proof that it was on the right path.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But following recent protests in several cities, its position has become increasingly difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The economy has been hit, and many are not happy after nearly three years of sporadic intense lockdowns but the government may now be coming to terms with the reality of living with the virus one month after the COP 27 climate change summit COP 15

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: on biodiversity kicks off in Canada. The objective for the 196 countries present is to halt the decline of life, and the call for action is urgent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to the latest World Wildlife Fund report, wildlife populations have on average declined by 69 percent since 1970. The current rapid rate of loss is a direct result of rampant human activity since the industrial revolution. Jen Hacking works for the global conservation division at World Wildlife Fund International. There's the imperative to conserve the habitats that we have in nature and the target is to conserve 30% of land, freshwater and oceans and restore global ecosystems by 2030. Now that's only eight years away now. So it's a big goal. This framework known as the 30 by 30 is the pinnacle countries will aim towards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hacking also says the COP15 should provide people the tools and knowledge of how to reverse the trend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: With a million species facing extinction, the issue is pressing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: You may not think that this might save an elephant in Africa, but is to reduce your food waste. So do we buy too much? Do we throw away too much? Do restaurants throw away too much? There's some evidence that we could probably reduce our food waste by half. And you're thinking, well, how could that save an elephant in Africa? Well, maybe that means that we don't need to deforest an extra hectare of land to produce palm oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: COP has yet to hit any target on biodiversity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Parties will have two weeks from now to overturn the trend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Serbian Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic is set to return to Australia for his 2023 Australian Open campaign at the Adelaide International in January. This comes after his visa was revoked nearly a year ago. Last January, the 35-year-old was deported over his stance on the COVID-19 vaccine. He was also handed a three-year visa ban, which was revoked last month by the current Australian government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Djokovic was not vaccinated against the coronavirus when he arrived in Melbourne ahead of the 2022 tournament, but Australia has since lifted strict rules for unvaccinated travellers. The world number five is aiming for his 10th Australian title after missing his chance in 2022. The 21 time winner will be joined in the men's draw by Andy Murray, Daniel Medvedev, Andre Rublev and Felix Auger Aliasim.
